"You can grant that ally a 6, if you are willing to change an unused 6 of your own rolls into a 5."
"You can make the save to retain memories a hard save (16+) or an easy save (6+)."
"Until the end of the battle, deal the damage again against enemies who roll a natural 1 on an attack."
"You can levitate and hover during your turn, but you must have solid ground under your feet by the end of it."

"You can use this spell to send an ally to a safe, alternate reality temporarily. The ally is held in suspended animation after the third save. The ally can decide how long he or she wants to remain in that state, and end it any time."
"You can expend focus to deal double damage with a sorcerer spell as if you had gathered power. You can expend your gathered power to gain the focus effect of a fateweaver spell."
"Your fateweaver Focus and your occultist Focus are considered the same thing. If you gain focus from a fateweaver class feature or spell, you can expend it on an occultist spell, and vice versa."
"Your haunted one can imbue a mundane item with a short message which can only be received by the intended recipient. The message is delivered by a spirit he binds to the item."
"Once per day a nearby ally can Rally as a quick action."
"Once per day when you spend one of your haunted one’s recoveries, roll d20’s for his Recovery dice."
"Once per day turn a critical hit against your haunted one into a normal hit."
"When using a shield, your haunted one also applies its defense bonus to his PD."

"Once per day your haunted one can summon 1d4+1 spectral mounts for up to an hour. The spectral mounts can fly, can travel five times faster than a horse, and obey his commands. The mounts won’t enter combat with him."
"When your haunted one misses with an odd attack roll and the escalation die is odd, deal half damage."

"Once per day your haunted one can grab something he normally couldn’t lift (a barrel, a bolder, a horse) and use it to make the following attack…
R: Improvised hurl (Str+Level vs AC) – 1d12 x level damage."
"The ability granted by the Champion Feat is now recharge 16+."
"Gain a +1 to all disengage checks."

"Your haunted one’s familiar gains a third ability. You may choose Ghost Light as the third ability, or may choose an ability from the standard list provided for the wizard’s familiar.

Ghost Light: Your haunted one’s familiar can be commanded to glimmer with a pale light, providing illumination via a spooky glow. The ghost light can be as dim as an ember or as bright as several lanterns."

"Your haunted one’s familiar gains a fourth ability. You may choose Pathos as the fourth ability, or may choose an ability from the standard list provided for the wizard’s familiar.

Pathos: Once per battle as a quick action your haunted one can banish his familiar and gain 1d4+1 points of Trauma. The familiar returns at the end of the battle."

"Your haunted one’s familiar gains a fifth ability. You may choose Keening as the fifth ability, or may choose an ability from the standard list provided for the wizard’s familiar.

Keening: Once per battle when your adventurer’s familiar is with him, an enemy who moves to engage him or attacks him takes thunder damage equal to his level plus his current unspent Trauma."
"Your haunted one may use Pain Is Gain twice per battle."
"Your haunted one now heals 1d6 hit points per point of Trauma spent."
"Your haunted one now heals 1d8 hit points per point of Trauma spent."

"Your haunted one has several ghostly servants, and though he only gets to request one task every five minutes, the tasks can be as complex as setting up a campsite, cleaning a room, or cooking a meal. Together the ghosts can move larger objects (pushing chairs, setting a table, making a bed) though their grasp on physical objects is still too weak to stop a solid person from resisting whatever they’re doing."

"Once per day your haunted one’s servants can mend an object as per the wizard’s Mend spell. His ghostly servants keep watch while he sleeps or is otherwise occupied, waking and warning him if there’s trouble (using his Wisdom modifier when rolling to spot approaching danger)."

"When your haunted one dies, his ghostly servants revive him and at the start of his next turn he returns to life with half his regular maximum hit points and recoveries, and a -1 to all rolls (attacks, saves, skill checks, etc). At his next full heal-up the -1 penalty and the reduction in hit points and recoveries disappear and he’s back to what passes for normal for him. This ability can only ever be used once."
"When your haunted one hits a creature taking ongoing damage with a natural even attack, he gains temporary HP equal to half his recovery value."
"Your haunted one can now Rally as a free action instead of a nearby ally when he uses this Talent, provided he hasn’t already Rallied this battle."
"When your haunted one hits a target taking ongoing damage with a natural 16+ melee attack, the save against the ongoing damage becomes a hard save (16+)."
"Your haunted one can now use this ability when an ally rolls a 1 or 2."
"Your haunted one can now use this ability when an ally rolls a 1, 2 or 3."
"Your haunted one can now use this ability on two Icon dice each day, provided they’re not his own."
"Your haunted one’s connection to the spirits allows him to stave off the grasp of death. He may cast the cleric spell Heal once per day."
"Your haunted one may add his Constitution or Charisma modifier to his Turn Undead attack roll in place of Wisdom."
"Your haunted one may cast Heal a number of times per day equal to his Constitution modifier."
"Your haunted one learns one rogue at-will power. It is recharge 12+ for him."
"You can add one rogue daily or recharge power to your haunted one’s list of abilities."
"Your haunted one gains a bonus to his defenses while in Wraith-Form equal to his current Trauma."

"When your haunted one is in Wraith-Form you may roll to end each save-ends effect on him. If he fails to save against an ongoing save-ends effect while he’s in Wraith-Form he gains a point of Trauma for each effect he failed to save against."
"While in Wraith-Form your haunted one can fly, but must land at the end of his movement."
"While moving as a quick action with his elongated arms, your haunted one gains a bonus to his defenses equal to his unspent Trauma."
"Once per battle at any point after using this attack, when making a haunted one melee attack your haunted one can use his elongated arms to perform a reach trick."
"Instead of using a quick action the movement is now a free action that doesn’t provoke attacks."

"Your haunted one gains resist poison 16+ when drinking or eating poisoned substances, and he never gets sick from eating gross stuff (such as maggoty meat, moldy bread, rotten wood, etc). He can stretch his jaw and throat in order to swallow non-living things whole (if it fits into his stomach and isn’t putting up a fight he can swallow it without chewing), and can choose not to digest swallowed items in order to vomit them later.
Once per battle when your haunted one misses with a Gnashing Maw attack, deal poison damage equal to his level to the target."
"Add your haunted one’s Constitution modifier to the damage enemies take when they fail to move away from him."

"Your haunted one can stretch his jaws so wide that he can perform impossible stunts like swallowing his own body, turning himself inside out, or stretching his lips over another person. The stunts offer no practical benefit, beyond making onlookers extremely grossed out."

"The recharge roll is now 11+.

Outside of battle as an at-will quick action (even if Grave-Fire is expended) your haunted one can summon a brief-lived pale ‘flame’ into his hand (or from another part of his body). The cold ‘fire’ goes out quickly, so he loses it if he stops concentrating (he needs to keep spending a quick action each round to maintain it). He can use the pale ‘fire’ to freeze small amounts of unattended liquids or as a form of illumination. He can freeze a tankard of ale in seconds, a bucket worth of water in less than a minute, and in an hour he can cool an approximately 10’x10’x10’ pit full of non-magical lava."
"The recharge roll is now 6+. The damage of the attack is now either fire or cold, whichever is worse for the target."
"If your haunted one fails to recharge, in his next battle he gains Trauma at the start of each of his turns equal to the escalation die value."
"The damage type of the attack is now psychic or thunder, whichever is worse for the target."
"Your haunted one can use his Keening Wail while singing, giving him a +4 bonus to skill checks when performing songs that are scary or mournful."
"Your haunted one’s Keening Wail ignores all damage resistances."
"Your haunted one can target undead and constructs with this attack, but you roll d10s for damage instead of d20s for damage on a natural odd hit."

"When your haunted one kills a creature with this attack, for the rest of the day he gains the benefit of the phantom servant familiar, as your haunted one forces his slain enemy to serve him while its spirit fades away. This prevents your enemy from returning from beyond the grave until the following day."

"Once per level your haunted one can use this Haunting as Mend Soul instead of Rend Soul. You must roll a save depending on how long the creature has been dead in order for Mend Soul to work:

Freshly Dead: Died within the last five minutes or so, there’s likely blood still leaking out of wounds (easy save, 6+)

Mostly Dead: Died within the last hour or so, the body’s probably slightly warm and the blood not yet fully congealed in the corpse (normal save, 11+)

Recently Dead: Died within the last day or so, the body’s mostly intact and not rotted yet (difficult save, 16+)

Very Dead: Dead and buried, the body’s rotten and maggoty or has been embalmed but the corpse is not yet just bones and mush (very difficult save, 19+)

If the save succeeds the target returns to life much as they were just before they died. The revived creature returns at only 1 hit point with 1 recovery and -1 to all their d20 rolls (skill checks, attack rolls, saves, etc). The revived creature returns to normal (full HP, full recoveries, no d20 roll penalty) after their next full heal-up.

A living creature can only be revived by Mend Soul once ever. The gateway to the beyond is not a revolving door."

"Your haunted one can use his tentacles outside of combat as extra limbs to hold and manipulate objects. For obvious reasons, seeing his flesh wreathed in shadows and stretched out into unearthly shapes has a tendency to make others uneasy. His tentacles mostly obey his mental commands, but sometimes take on a life of their own if your haunted one isn’t paying them full attention.
When your haunted one would take falling damage, roll a save (11+); on a success his tentacles catch him and arrest his fall so he takes no damage."
"Once per battle your haunted one can target 1d4+1 nearby enemies in a group."
"Add one extra enemy to the number of enemies your haunted one can target (1d3+1 engaged enemies; once per battle 1d4+2 nearby enemies in a group)."
"Weakened enemies are also vulnerable (attacks against them gain a +2 bonus to critical range)."
"Enemies taking ongoing psychic damage are also vulnerable."

"Twice per day when you use this power and it kills the target, as an immediate free action you teleport to the spot that they occupied (you tear open the barrier between worlds and step through it, briefly walking through the otherworldly land of the dead, and step out standing above the body of your victim). This is always accompanied by ghostly phenomena; you can’t do this stealthily."

"Occasionally walls bleed in your haunted one’s presence. Your haunted one doesn’t control this, and often he’s the only person who can see the blood. Sometimes the blood spells out cryptic warnings from the departed. This doesn’t guarantee that the dead ever have anything comforting to say to your haunted one; the sort of spirits who write messages in dripping blood are usually very angry about something.
When you roll no 5s or 6s with your icon dice, change one result to a 5 as a message in blood aids your adventurer."
"If your haunted one crits with this attack, the target starts to bleed from their eyes and is stunned (save ends)."

"Once per day your haunted one can teleport from one pool of blood to another nearby or far away pool of blood. A bleeding wound large enough for him to dive into counts as a pool of blood for the purposes of his teleportation."
"Your haunted one gains a +2 bonus to climbing skill checks, skill checks involving escaping from bonds through contortion, and to slipping bonelessly through bars."
"On a natural odd hit your haunted one may move as a free action into engagement with the target. His free movement on an odd hit provokes attacks."
"On an odd hit, your haunted one’s free movement into engagement with the target no longer provokes attacks."
"Your haunted one’s hair grows at a supernaturally fast rate, maybe as much as a foot a day. His hair has an unusual property that you and your GM should decide upon."

"Your haunted one can mentally command his hair to style itself, though it makes odd little screaming noises as it does so. His hair has a mind of its own sometimes and a supernatural danger sense – when he falls from a height, his hair has a 50% chance of lassoing a hand-hold and stopping his fall."

"When your haunted one falls unconscious or helpless in a battle his hair attempts to drag him away from enemies and towards allies. While he’s unconscious or helpless your GM controls his hair and decides where it drags him, though it never drags him into danger."
"Your haunted one can count himself as an ally for the purposes of triggering this Haunting, using it when enemies make a melee attack against him."
"Once per day your haunted one may use this Haunting when the triggering attack isn’t a melee attack but is instead a close or ranged attack."
"Once per battle (or once every five minutes) your haunted one may fly as a move action, landing at the end of the movement."

"Your haunted one can mold and reshape his own flesh, gaining a +2 bonus to skill checks to quickly disguise himself or a +4 bonus if he has access to a mirror and an hour or so of free time. Given enough time he can completely and permanently change his outward appearance."

"Targets hit by this Haunting become stuck (save ends, 11+) as your haunted one uses the power of this Haunting to temporarily (and painfully) cause their flesh to meld with itself. He can now reshape the flesh of willing allies, though the completed change lasts only a few hours."

"Normally your haunted one can only use this Haunting when an enemy tries to move away from him by moving or rolling to disengage. This feat lets him make the attack if the enemy popped free or teleported or otherwise moved as part of a non-move action."

"As a quick action while in battle, once per day, roll to recharge an item power (even if your haunted one failed to recharge it earlier in the day). You gain a bonus to the recharge roll equal to your haunted one’s current unspent Trauma."
"Once per day, for one battle, odd melee attack rolls target MD instead of the defense that the attack normally targets."
"Once per day, a target your haunted one hits can no longer attack anyone except your haunted one (save ends)."
"The save from the Champion feat increases to a hard save (16+)."
"Gain a +5 bonus to opportunity attacks."

"Your haunted one can call on the courtesan ghost during social situations. Once per day he may swap his highest attribute and his Charisma for all social skill checks (but not attacks) for one hour."

"Your haunted one can make a Charisma-based attack versus the MD of any nearby non-allied intelligent creature that he’s in conversation with. On a hit, the creature answers a single yes/no question honestly. If the creature is of a higher level than your haunted one it realizes that he has forced it to answer honestly."
"Your haunted one’s critical hits add his current Trauma to their damage before the damage is doubled."
"Your haunted one can spend a recovery to add +5 to all Charisma skill checks for a couple of hours or until the start of his next fight (whichever is first)."

"When your haunted one calls upon this spirit his appearance is altered, leading others to believe him to be a beautiful noble. While not a true disguise (he still kind of looks like himself), he might be able to convince city guards that he’s a noble and not a heavily armed riff-raff adventurer and so should be let in to the party the guards are trying to keep him away from (similar to the wizard trick of “You wouldn’t take a walking staff from an old man”). Of course, if your haunted one is already a beautiful noble then perhaps the ‘great beauty’ was a licentious poet instead."
"Once per day it takes two hits to deactivate this Indwelling Haunting."
"Your haunted one’s defense bonus from this Haunting now applies to PD as well."
"Your haunted one’s defense bonus from this Haunting now applies to MD as well."
"Once per day for one battle, your haunted one gains resistance to normal weapons equal to his current Trauma."
"If your haunted one sings while fighting his attacks deal holy damage on an even hit."
"Enemies engaged with your haunted one can’t attack and roll to disengage in the same turn."

"Pick a general class of weapons (one-handed small, two-handed martial, small crossbow, etc); once per day for one battle when your adventurer fights with a weapon of that class, he doesn’t take a weapon die size penalty when making attacks from his non-haunted one class. You can take this feat multiple times for more weapon categories."

"Pick a specific type of weapon (dagger, longbow, rapier, etc) within the general class from the Adventurer feat; when the escalation die is even your adventurer doesn’t take a weapon die size penalty when making attacks from his non-haunted one class. You can take this feat multiple times for more weapons from your weapon categories granted from the Adventurer feat."
"If the escalation die is 2+, you can add a small additional effect to the power, such as healing 1 hp per level or giving a +1 bonus to the next saving throw."
"Instead of reducing the augmentation cost, you can pay it and target both yourself and the ally with the power as a benefit."
"When a nearby ally makes a skill check, you can expend 1 PP to grant them a 1d6 bonus to the roll."
"When you hit with a weapon or an unarmed attack, you can spend 1 PP to deal 1d6 extra fire, lightning, or force damage (2d6 at 5th level; 3d6 at 8th)."
"Reroll any natural 1s on the damage dice of energenesis powers."
"Once per battle, you can spend 2 PP to deal maximum damage when you hit with an energenesis power."
"When you spend a recovery to heal, you can expend 1 PP to heal 1d6 extra hp (2d6 at 5th level; 3d6 at 8th level)."
"When you make a save against the hampered, stuck, vulnerable, or weakened conditions, or against ongoing damage, you can expend a power point to add 1d6 to the roll."
"When you make a death save, you can spend 1 PP to gain a 1d6 bonus to the roll."
"Enemies must have an MD of 12 + your level to be able to save against your invisibility."
"You can cover allies in your invisibility by expending 2 PP per ally. They don’t get the double damage."
"You gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range with the aimed attack."
"Once per battle, you can use the aim to make a stunt shot with a psionic power without an attack penalty. For example, you could rip a ring off an enemy’s finger with psychoportation."
"You can spend 2 PP instead for a +3 to attack and +3 to critical threat range."
"When you roll initiative, you can spend 1 PP to gain a 1d6 bonus to the roll."
"Once per round, you can spend 1 PP to add 1d6 to AC or PD against an enemy attack."
"Increase your light armored base AC to 12."
"When you make a disengage check, you can expend a power point to add 1d6 to the roll."
"When a psychoportation power allows you to move (fly, teleport . . .) to a nearby location, you can expend 1 PP to move to a far away location instead."
"When you manifest a psychoportation power, you can spend 1 PP to add another target."
"When you expend 1 PP to gain a bonus to a Wisdom check, you retain that bonus until the end of the scene."
"You can always act during surprise rounds."
"Once per battle, you can expend 1 PP to manifest a clairsentience power as a quick action."
"If you have zero PP left, roll two dice."
"You can use this talent during combat when you rally. Spend a recovery, but instead of regaining hit points, regain power points."
"When you spend a recovery to heal, you regain one power point."
"When something you create with a metacreation power takes damage, reduce that damage by your level."
"Whenever you deal damage with a metacreation power, including a summoned creation, reroll any natural 1s on the damage dice."
"When something you create with a metacreation power makes an attack, you can spend 1 PP to add 1d6 to the roll."
"When an enemy makes a save against your telepathy powers, you can expend 1 PP to give the enemy a 1d6 penalty to the roll."
"When you save against the dazed, stunned, or confused conditions, or ongoing psychic damage, you can expend a power point to add 1d6 to the roll."
"When you make an attack against the PD or AC of an enemy, you can expend 1 PP to attack MD instead."
"Roll twice on the High Weirdness table and choose the result you like."
"Gain power points equal to the escalation die +1."
"Gain power points equal to the escalation die plus 1d4."
"Augmentation (2 PP) You can change your entire physical appearance, even race and gender, as long as weight and body shape stay roughly the same."
"You gain a rough sense of the strength of the presence, say whether it’s just one orc, or an army."
"Augmentation (2 PP) You can reestablish the mind link with someone you had a link to in the past, as long as the target is roughly within a mile distance."
"The item appears natural to the untrained eye."
"You can create one manifestation per Intelligence modifier at once."
"Augmentation (1 PP) Move a number of items equal to your Dexterity modifier at once."
"Heal with 2 additional recovery dice per PP when augmenting."
"Heal with 3 additional recovery dice per PP when augmenting."
"Give your construct one bonus ability, such as speaking or flying. Refer to the Wizard’s Familiar talent for a list of examples."
"You can target far away enemies at a -2 penalty to hit."
"Augmentation (2 PP) Deal double damage (half lightning, half thunder)."
"You can augment the power for a second attack on a natural even miss too."
"You don’t provoke opportunity attacks with this power."
"On a natural even hit, increase the damage dice to d10."
"Deal half damage to one enemy you missed."
"You can manifest this power as an interrupt action when you are targeted by an attack against MD."
"If you are attacked against MD, immediately save against any “save ends” effects of that attack."
"You can use this power as an interrupt action when you are targeted by an attack that deals elemental damage."
"Deal additional force damage equal to your Constitution modifier (x3) when you resist damage."
"Reroll any natural 1s on the damage dice."
"If the escalation die is 2+, increase the damage dice to d12s."
"You don’t provoke opportunity attacks with this power."
"Deal half damage on a miss."
"Increase the base and augmentation damage dice to d10s."
"If the target is staggered, choose a 1 PP augmentation for free."
"You create a link that allows the target to give an answer."
"Add 2 extra targets per PP when augmenting."
"You can use this power as a free action after you make a d20 roll to reroll the die."
"You gain a +2 bonus to melee and ranged attack rolls until the end of your next turn."
"You don’t take a penalty to attack with ranged weapons, even when not manifesting this power."
"On a natural even hit, gain 1 PP to augment this power for free."
"Gain the bonus effect of a second discipline."
"Increase the AC bonus to +3 (+5 augmented)."
"If you wield a psi crystal with an enchantment bonus, your created weapon gains the attack and damage bonus granted by that crystal."
"Gain the bonus effect of a second discipline."
"Augmentation (2 PP) Increase the weapon’s damage dice by two steps (usually to d10)."
"Add your Intelligence modifier (x2 at 5th level; x3 at 8th) to hit points regained with this power."
"You can concentrate on a specific type of danger, such as traps or monsters."
"You can manifest this power as a free action on your turn or an ally’s turn."
"You can manifest this power as a quick action."
"You can manifest this power as a quick action."
"On a natural even hit, reduce the augmentation cost to weaken until the end of your next turn to zero."
"You can also create the opposite effect and make a person or object completely repugnant to the target."
"Augmentation (1–3 PP) The target takes a -2 penalty to its save per PP."
"The target adds the escalation die to hit."
"On a critical hit, the effect persists a second turn."
"Increase the damage dice to d10s."
"On a miss, the target takes a -5 penalty to disengage checks until the end of its next turn."
"When you target a group of mooks, multiply the number of affected targets by 3."
"Deal your level in psychic damage to the attacker."
"Augmentation (1 PP) Gain a +2 bonus to AC until the end of your next turn."
"You are immune to damage while in suspended animation."
"You can change the turret’s damage to fire."
"The turret has a +2 bonus to hit against mooks."
"Deal damage equal to twice your level."
"Augment (2-6 PP) Target an additional enemy per 2 PP."
"Augmentation (1 PP) The effect lasts until the next full heal-up."
"On a natural even hit, reduce the total augmentation cost by 1 PP."
"On a natural even miss, make a second attack roll against a different nearby enemy."
"The save is a hard save (16+)."
"When manifesting the power, you gain 1d4 pieces of information immediately."
"On a miss, you can spend 1 PP to avoid the backlash damage."
"On a natural 16+ attack roll, gain 1 PP to augment the power for free."
"Augment for 20 ongoing damage per PP."
"On a natural even hit, deal 1d10 extra damage (8th level: 2d10)."
"Augmentation (2–6 PP) Target one additional weapon per 2 PP."
"On a critical hit, the hampered effect is (save ends)."
"You no longer take a penalty to attacks, but you are still vulnerable while levitating."
"You can choose to only project one eye. The split vision can be quite confusing, but at least you are not oblivious to dangers that are right in front of you."
"Augmentation (3 PP) You can manifest this power as a quick action."
"Deal 1d10 (8th level: 2d10) extra energy damage on a miss."
"On a hit, deal twice your level in force damage to the attacker."
"You are immune to critical hits."
"Your unarmed attacks gain a +2 bonus to their critical threat range."
"The target only notices you using psionics on a natural 1 on the attack roll."
"You can use the spell as a close-quarters spell against a nearby target."
"The eye also perceives sound and smell."
"You can designate one ally per intelligence modifier to receive the visions."
"Attack the lower of the target’s PD or MD."
"Augmentation (2 PP) Polymorph into a creature of any type."
"You can target two enemies or a group of mooks with total hit points up to the limit."
"Reduce the manifesting cost by 1 for each panicked enemy on the battlefield."
"You can use this power to slowly grow back lost limbs (curse you, owlbears!) or heal similar permanent damage. The healing process requires weeks and several uses of the power."
"You can concentrate on the wall as a quick action and move it slowly, dragging any stuck enemies with it."
"If the target fails three saves in a row, it is stuck in that form for a full day."
"An enemy targeting your PD must roll twice and take the lower result."
"An enemy targeting your MD must roll twice and take the lower result."
"Augmentation (2 PP) You can throw the target into a time vortex that removes it from the battlefield temporarily (save ends)."
"When your golem drops to 0 hp, it explodes and deals 20 (9th level: 40) acid damage to all enemies it was engaged with."
"On a natural even hit, you can spend a recovery to heal."
"If the dice you roll for this power are at least twice as big as the normal dice on the table, you gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range."
"Increase the duration to 1d6 hours."
"When using this power as an interrupt, roll d8 for damage."
"If you have no PP left, you can spend a recovery to pay the base cost of this power."
"The target is also dazed (save ends both)."
"Gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range with this power."
"Augmentation (2 PP) Increase the suit’s stats and bonuses to 17 base AC, 250 temporary hit points and Strength 26."
"You can target a group of mooks with a combined hit point total equal to the limit or lower."
"On a miss, the target must succeed on a save to notice the intrusion."
"You can manifest this power as an interrupt action when you are attacked."
"Gain an 8-point background instead."
"Double the effect of each PP spent to augment this power."
"You can teleport to a location known to one of the targets."
"When an attack reduces you below zero hit points, you can use Frenzied Healing as an interrupt action to heal back up from zero hit points. You have to expend your entire frenzy pool if you do so."
"Add the escalation die to mounted combat control checks."
"When your mount hits with an attack, add your FRENZY to the damage."
"When a save by your mount is an even failure, you can reroll the check once."
"When your frenzy dice pool is at maximum, gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range with melee attacks."
"Increase the critical threat range bonus to +3."
"You can use your melee attack frenzy powers as thrown weapon ranged attacks instead."
"Once per battle, when an enemy successfully disengages from you, make a thrown weapon attack against that enemy as an interrupt action."
"Reroll natural 2s on the attack roll with thrown weapons."
"Gain a bonus recovery."
"Add your Constitution modifier even when not staggered."
"You can heal above your maximum hit points with Frenzied Healing. Any excess hit points vanish at the end of the battle."
"Gain a +1 bonus to PD in heavy armor."
"Gain a +1 bonus to saving throws in heavy armor."
"Gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing heavy armor."
"When wielding a two-handed melee weapon, gain a +1 bonus to hit against large and huge monsters."
"When wielding a two-handed melee weapon, gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range against large and huge monsters."
"When wielding a two-handed melee weapon, deal triple damage on a critical hit against large and huge monsters."
"When you rally, gain frenzy dice as if you had hit with a melee attack this turn."
"When you rally, a nearby ally can use a recovery to heal."
"When you rally, gain a +2 bonus to attacks and defenses until the end of your next turn."
"You gain a +1 bonus to saves against conditions."
"Once per battle, when you are unable to take actions during your turn (such as when stunned or unconscious), you can take a standard action."
"While staggered, you can choose to ignore the effects of any other condition. Note that when your hp drop to zero, you are no longer staggered, so the effect ends and you fall unconscious."
"Once per scene, you can turn to your ancestors for guidance when making a skill check. Roll a d6. If the result is even, add it to your roll."
"Once per battle, the spirits can guide your blade when making an attack. Roll a d6. If the result is even, add it to the roll."
"Whenever you make a death save, roll a d6. If it is even, add it to the roll."
"Gain the adept effect of the aspect."
"The aspect is now Recharge 16+."
"You gain the Shake It Off power from the Shifter talent."
"When wielding two melee weapons, gain a +1 bonus to hit against mooks."
"When wielding two melee weapons, gain a +2 bonus to your critical threat range against mooks."
"When wielding two melee weapons, deal triple damage with critical hits against mooks."

Target: 1d4 + 1 enemies near the singularity

"Gain +2 to any skill check involving negotiation, diplomacy, treaties, or historical knowledge.
Once per full heal-up, you may declare a known historical precedent during a social interaction to automatically succeed on an Intelligence or Charisma skill check."

"Once per day when acting as a mediator in a dispute, you may cause all hostile participants to make a hard save (16+). On a failure, they will no longer be able to take hostile actions until they consider at least one full proposal."

"Gain +2 to skill checks involving domesticated animals, mount training, herbalism, or metalwork.
Once per full heal-up, raft or repurpose a mundane item (such as rope, caltrops, a simple trap, or 1-use tool) from local materials without a check, as long as you have 10 minutes."

"You have +2 to saves and skill checks involving physical endurance, exhaustion, or resisting forced movement.
Once per full heal-up, when you would fall unconscious or drop to 0 HP, you instead stay standing with 1 HP."
"Once per full heal-up, when Echoes of the Deep causes an enemy to miss or you succeed on the reroll, you may knock the attacker off balance—they are dazed (save ends)."

"Once per full heal-up, when you are staggered, you may invoke the name of a dwarven deity to gain resist all damage 12+ until the end of your next turn. If you are underground or near a religious relic, the resistance improves to 14+."
"Once per full heal-up, anytime after you succeed on Ancient Aptitudes,  you can force an enemy to reroll one d20 roll."

"Once per day, when you see a spell being cast, you may make a skill check (DC determined by GM) to identify the nature, origin, or weaknesses of that magic. On a success, the caster takes a –2 penaly to hit with that spell or similar effects until the end of the battle."
"Once per battle when your Windpiercer Instinct hits, the terrain around your target shifts and all enemies near them are stuck  until the end of your next turn."

"Once per full heal-up, you may commune briefly with the natural world. Gain +2 to all perception or survival-based skill checks for the next hour, and plants or animals will not obstruct your path unless they have been magically commanded to do so."
"Once per battle, you can reroll your Wanderer's Echo when the escalation die is 4+."

"When you enter a new terrain or settlement for the first time, you may declare a piece of lore, tradition, or route you already know from stories or dreams. Once per full heal-up, you may use this lore to gain a +2 bonus to any one check involving travel, navigation, or social blending."
"Once per full heal-up, Manifest Fury targets all nearby enemies not engaged with you. Those damaged become vulnerable to your next attack."

"Gain +1 to saves against forced movement. Once per full heal-up, choose to automatically succeed against an effect that would force you to move or be knocked down and gain resist weapon damage 14+ for 1d4 rounds."
"Once per battle, when you roll a 1–5 on a d20, reroll it. If the result is 16+, gain +1 to all defenses until the end of your next turn and end one source of ongoing damage or condition."
"You may breathe underwater and swim at full speed. Once per battle, move through enemies like a crashing wave: automatically disengage and ignore difficult terrain this turn."
"When staggered, your attacks deal an extra 1d6 per tier fire damage and you shed dim light. You can ignite flammable objects that you touch."
"Once per day, when a nearby ally would drop to 0 HP, swap places with them and take the hit instead. You gain resist all 16+ until the end of your next turn."

"You gain resist cold damage 12+.
Once per battle as a free action, you may declare a creature you can see as Marked Prey. Until the end of the battle, you deal an extra 1d8 per tier damage to that creature. You gain temporary HP equal to your level on a successful hit against them if they are staggered."

"If an enemy drops to 0 HP from an attack while Predator’s Pulse is active, extend the effect’s duration by 1 additional round (maximum once per round). If the fallen enemy is a non-mook, you also gain temporary HP equal to [2x your level]."

"Once per battle, declare a Threshold(a narrow chokepoint, an ally, or a defineable terrain feature). While within nearby range of the threshold, you gain +1 to AC & PD. Enemies attempting to cross the threshold must roll a normal save. On a fail, they are stuck (save ends) and you may make a basic melee attack (once per turn) against the target."

"Once per battle,while not staggered, you can enter an Anchor Stance. While in this stance, you gain the following benefits:
You gain resist damage 12+
Nearby enemies must succeed on a normal save (11+) to target any creature other than you with an attack or spell
Nearby allies gain a +1 bonus to defenses against area attacks and close-spell effects"
"Enemies hit by your Draconic Lineage are vulnerable to your next attack (save ends)."
"Use Draconic Lineage twice per battle. It now ignores resistance."
"Once per day, when an ally fails a skill check, allow them to reroll it with a +2 bonus from your remembered insight."
"When you successfully disengage using Flock Instinct, all nearby allies gain +2 to their next disengage or interrupt check during this battle."
"If you fly during your turn, enemies take –1 to attack rolls against you until the start of your next turn."
"Skyline Presence now allows you to break free from any constraint that prevents flight, including magical ones."
"Once per battle. If you start your turn unengaged and dive to attack a target in melee, they become vulnerable until the end of the battle."
"Once per battle, sing in layered tones that cause confusion in all nearby enemies for 1d4 rounds."
"Once per battle, when a non-mook enemy drops to 0 HP nearby, regain HP equal to your level + Wis mod."
"Once per battle, flare with ancestral power: gain +1 to all defenses for the rest of the battle and your next attack deals an extra 1d6 damage per tier."

"Gain +2 to perception & search-related skill checks. Once per full heal-up, automatically succeed on a check relying on sight.
Once per battle, if an enemy misses you, make a basic ranged or spell attack as a free action."
"You gain the temporary HP immediately when you become staggered, even if your next attack misses."
"Once per full heal-up, you may use Twilight Ingenuity a second time during a battle."

"Once per full heal-up, you may ask one question about a person, item, or place; the GM must give a short, true answer. If the answer reveals an immediate danger or opportunity, you gain +2 to your next attack or skill check related to it."

"Once per battle when you are staggered, roll a d6:
5–6: Deal [2 × level] your choice of psychic, fire, or necrotic damage to all enemies you are engaged with.
1–4: Deal fire damage to all enemies you are engaged with equal to your level. You also take 5 damage (cannot be reduced)."

"Once per battle, after failing a d20 roll, you may choose to swap the ability modifier used for that roll with another ability modifier of your choice. If this changes the result to a success, you gain a +2 bonus to your next attack roll in this battle."
"You may now use this trait on a natural even hit instead of a miss. Add half the recovery’s HP as bonus damage to the attack."

"Gain +2 to Stealth-related checks.
Once per battle, when missed in dim light or darkness, your next attack deals an extra 1d8 per tier and lets you teleport to a nearby shadow as a free action."

"Gain +1 to all saves while staggered.
When suffering from a condition or ongoing damage, you may sacrifice HP in 5-point increments to end one of the ongoing effects. For every 5 HP, gain a Radiant Charge (max 3 per full heal-up). You can expend a Radiant Charge to: 
Deal level + [Con mod per tier] radiant damage to any enemy involved in the battle
Let an ally reroll a failed d20 roll
Unspent Radiant Charges fade at the end of battle or during a full heal-up."
"Touched by Divinity now affects all creatures involved in a battle. Once per full heal-up, you may reroll one failed d20 roll as divine will intervenes."

"Once per battle, you manifest spectral wings that allow you to fly. On the turn your wings appear, you can fly without provoking opportunity attacks. On subsequent turns, you must roll a normal save. On a success, you may continue to fly; on a fail, you must land by the end of your turn or fall. While flying, ranged and spell attacks against you suffer –2 to hit."

"You can always detect oath-breakers among nearby creatures. Once per day, curse a creature hostile to you: they are vulnerable to your attacks (save ends). When the curse ends, the target takes psychic damage equal to [2x your level]."

"Once per battle, on a natural even hit, remove the target from initiative count for 1d4 turns. When they return, you choose where in the order they go, and you gain temporary HP equal to [your level + Int or Wis mod]."

"Once per battle as a quick action, enter the Stance of the Burning Horizon. You take 2 ongoing fire damage per turn until you choose to end the stance as another quick action. While in the stance:
Gain a +2 to saves against fear and other sources of ongoing damage
Ranged attacks that use projectiles have a -2 penalty against you
Your melee attacks deal an extra 1d4 per tier fire damage
You shed dim light in close range."

"Once per battle, you may expend one of your recoveries as a quick action and choose an ally to regain one expended spell, power, or recharge-based ability. Both you and the chosen ally regain HP equal to half the Recovery roll.
Once per full heal-up, you may use this feature without expending a Recovery."

"Once per full heal-up, make a nearby enemy either forget the last round (negating any benefits it gained) or re-live the last round (taking half the damage they took again).
The first time you stagger an enemy after using this trait, you can use it once again for free."

"Once per battle as a quick action, declare a Command Priority. Until the start of your next turn, you and all nearby allies gain +1 to attack rolls against a single enemy you can see. If that enemy is defeated before your next turn, you or an ally of your choice may immediately Rally as a free action. If the escalation die is 3+ when this trait is triggered, the Rally is free."
"The first time you are staggered each battle, gain temporary HP equal to [escalation die × Con mod]."

"Once per full heal-up, after triggering Bloodline Resurgence, you may invoke the memory of a past battle. Until the end of the battle, your melee attacks deal an additional 1d8 per tier damage and your crit range expands by 1."
"When you use Crafted Might, all nearby allies gain +2 to their next attack roll in this battle. Once per full heal-up, you can choose to maximize your damage instead of rolling."

"Once per battle, you may declare that you improvise, forge, or reshape a small physical item or tool (weapon part, lockpick, climbing aid, ritual focus, etc.) to gain +2 to a related skill check.
If used in combat, you may instead create a temporary object that either:
Grants cover to you or an ally until the end of your next turn
imposes a –2 penalty on a single enemy's next attack"
"When you roll initiative while missing HP, gain an extra 1d6 per tier bonus damage to your first attack and +1 to all defenses until the start of your next turn."
"Once per day, you may start rolling a d4 instead of a d6."
"You gain +2 to initiative rolls. In the first round of combat, your first successful attack against an enemy that hasn’t acted yet deals +1d6 per tier bonus damage."
"Once per battle, if you start your turn without having moved or attacked on your previous turn, you may and all allies engaged with the same enemy as you regain HP equal to [your level + Wis mod]."
"When your resistance triggers, the attacker becomes hampered until the end of their next turn."

"You gain +1 to skill checks related to stonework, crafting, or underground terrain. You can wield one extra magic item without suffering item quirks, and you gain a +1 bonus to recharge rolls for magic item powers."
"At the start of each battle, roll initiative twice and choose the result you want. If you roll a natural 19 or 20 for initiative, increase the escalation die by 1."
"You may now use this trait twice per battle. On a reroll of 16+, you also gain +1 to your next attack roll during this battle."
"Once per battle, when you succeed on a save against a magical effect, your next spell or magical ability gains +1 to its attack roll or spell DC and ignores resistance."
"Once per battle, when you hit with a ranged attack against an enemy who is behind cover, engaged with an ally, or midair, deal an extra 1d6 per tier damage."

"If your initiative roll is odd, gain +1 to your first attack roll this battle.

Once per battle, after you successfully disengage, gain +2 to your next skill check or add 2 to your initiative score, potentially moving you in the turn order."

"Once per battle, when a nearby ally misses with an attack, you may use a quick action to make a basic attack against the same target. If your attack hits, your ally may reroll their missed attack as a free action."
"If that attack misses, you may reroll the attack roll once. On a hit, gain +1 to AC and PD until the end of your next turn instead of the Temporary HP."
"Once per battle, forgo rolling damage on a melee attack and deal maximum damage instead. If the lethal attack was a crit, you can use lethal once more in this battle."

"Once per battle as a free action after you have been hit by an enemy attack, you can heal using a rolled recovery. If the escalation die is less than 2, you only get half the usual healing from the recovery. you cannot use this ability if the attack drops you to 0 HP or below."
"Targets damaged by this attack are also stuck (save ends)."
"You may use Wyrmrage Instinct a second time per battle when you drop an enemy to 0 HP."

"Once per battle, make a close-quarters breath weapon attack as a quick action using your Str or Con (your choice) against one nearby enemy’s Physical Defense. On a hit, the attack deals [1d6 per level] of either fire or lightning damage (your choice)."
"Your first crit each battle restores temporary HP equal to [Level + Con mod]. While staggered, your crits deal +1 weapon die and force the target to pop free."
"The second target is also dazed until the end of your next turn."
"The energy spreads: choose up to 1d4 nearby mooks to receive the damage instead of just one target."

"You gain resist fire 12+. Once per full heal-up, you may ignore the first instance of ongoing damage against you. The enemy that inflicted the ongoing damage takes fire damage equal to [level + Int or Str mod]."

"If you have an attack penalty with any type of axe or hammer from your class, remove that penalty. When you wield an axe or a hammer you can already use without an attack penalty from your class, you can reroll natural 1's on weapon damage dice."
"Enemies that miss you or trigger your resistance while this trait is active take damage equal to [your level + Wis or Con mod]."

"Once per full heal-up, when you cast a healing spell or an ally spends a recovery, all nearby allies can remove one instance of ongoing damage or gain a +2 to their next save against a condition. If they are staggered, they also gain temporary HP equal to their level."

"Once per battle, as a standard action, you can choose one of the following options:
Push all engaged enemies away, popping you and all nearby allies free. Flying enemies must roll a normal save or fall. Enemies hit with this trait take damage equal to [your level + Str or Wis mod].
Pull all nearby enemies towards you. They are now considered engaged with you and any nearby allies. Any enemies that were already engaged take 1d6 per tier cold damage and are hampered until the end of your next turn"
"Your Omen remains after your first dismissal effect, fading only after the second."
"While overclocked, gain resist damage 14+."

"Once per battle, when you take damage from a melee or close-quarters attack, inflict the attacker with ongoing acid damage equal to your level (save ends). If the attacker is staggered, they are also weakened until the end of their next turn."

"Once per battle when a friend or foe targets you with a spell, power, or ability, you may store its echo. Until the end of the battle, you may reuse that effect once as a standard action, using your own stats."

"Whenever you roll a natural even hit with a melee or ranged attack, gain +1 point of war focus (max +3). Each point increases your crit range by 1. When you roll a natural 20 and have at least 1 point of war focus, you deal maximum crit damage. Your war focus resets after you crit or at the end of a battle."
"You may now benefit from Natural Harmony even in non-natural terrain, as long as you're touching a natural object."

"Once per battle, as a free action you can use a recovery on yourself or an ally (does not count as a Rally). In addition to regaining HP, choose one of the following effects:
Target gains +1 to saves until the end of their next turn
Another ally near the target heals HP equal to [half your level + Wis Mod per tier].
Target gains resist 12+ damage until the start of their next turn"

"Once per battle, you can summon a plant-formed construct. Choose from one of the following options:
Vineguard (interrupt). A wall of vines absorbs an attack targeting only you or one nearby ally. The attack is completely blocked, unless it deals fire damage. The vines can soak fire damage equal to [your level + Wis mod], with the original target of the attack taking the remainder.
Spinebloom (quick action). A mass of thorns erupts underneath an enemy you can see, dealing [1d6 + Wis mod] per tier and making the enemy stuck (save ends).
Glowspores (quick action). A cloud of luminescent spores float through the air, surrounding you and all nearby creatures. You and all allies in the area gain +2 to their next attack roll and all attacks targeting you or your allies have a -2 penalty until the end of your next turn."

"Enemies engaged with you suffer a –1 penalty to saves. Once per battle, when you hit an enemy with a damage type they are resistant to, reduce that resistance by –2 until the end of the battle. If the enemy has universal resistance, it is reduced by –1 instead. If the enemy has no resistances, you instead deal an extra [1d4 per tier] necrotic damage with your attack as the decay seeps into their defenses."

"Once per battle you can choose to become rooted as a move action. While rooted you cannot be forcibly moved and enemies have a -1 penalty to disengage from you. Whenever you are hit by an attack, roll a save. On 11+, reduce the damage by half and gain resist weapon damage 12+ until the end of your next turn. You can continue to be rooted on subsequent turns by spending your move action."

"When you succeed on a composure save, you may instead choose to transform willingly and gain temporary HP equal to [level + escalation die]. If you still have a bonus to attack rolls from previous successes, they carry over to your Beast Form."

"You may enter Beast Form without a composure check. While transformed, gain +1 to all saves. In addition, you gain advantage on disengage rolls, and natural 20s on your Beast Form attacks restore HP equal to [2x your level]."
"If your Hornbreaker Charge is intercepted by an enemy, they are pushed aside and also take the bonus charge damage."

"Once per battle, when you resist a mental effect (confusion, domination, fear, etc.) or succeed on a save against an effect that deals psychic damage, your next attack becomes a mindpiercing strike.  This attack deals an extra 1d6 per tier damage and ignores all resistances. If the target of your attack is a spellcaster, they suffer a -1 penalty to their next d20 roll."

"When an enemy rolls a natural 1–5 against you, you gain an echo resonance. You may spend the echo as a free action to allow yourself or a nearby ally to reroll a failed save, disengage check, or recharge roll. You can only hold one echo at a time, and it fades after a full heal-up if not used. The target of the echo also gains a +1 to AC and MD until the end of their next turn."
"When you trigger Stonebound Memory, you gain +1 to MD until the end of your next turn. If the triggering roll is a save, you also gain temporary HP equal to [2 × your level]."
"Once per full heal-up, you may activate Stonebound Memory as a free action, even without a triggering roll. This use does not consume your once-per-battle usage."

"Once per full heal-up, when casting a spell you can channel one of these effects:
The spell is cast as if it were 1 level higher
The range of the spell is increased one stage (close > nearby > far > very far)
The spell can affect 1 additional target"

"While staggered, you get +1 to attacks and +2 to damage. The first time you become staggered in battle, roll a d6:
1-2: You become vulnerable (save ends).
3-4: You deal 5 per tier psychic damage to all nearby enemies
5-6: You gain resist 12+ to all damage until the end of your next turn"
"Once per battle, after you miss with an attack, immediately make a second basic attack or cast an at-will spell against the same target with a –2 penalty."
"You gain +2 to disengage checks. One battle per full heal-up, you can ignore the sunlight restriction for flight."
"Echoing Cry  is now a free action and you can make a basic attack as a quick action immediately after. Your attacks against enemies affected by Echo Fang have their crit range increased by 1."

"Instead of a basic attack, you now do damage equal to [your level + Dex per tier] to all nearby enemies after you teleport. You may use this feature a second time after you reduce a non-mook enemy to 0 HP."
"You may mark two enemies per battle. if a marked enemy dies, you regain HP equal to [5x the escalation die]."

"You have learned some of the runes of power used by your people. Once per full heal-up choose which rune you have carved in your body. As a free action on your turn, you can trigger the rune's effect.
Rune of Endurance. Gain +1 to all saves and resist weapon damage 12+ until the end of your next turn.
Rune of Warding. Until the end of your next turn, gain +2 to all defenses against ranged attacks and spells. If you do not move during this turn, also gain resist psychic 12+ until the start of your following turn.
Rune of Directive. When a nearby ally fails a save or attack roll, have them reroll it with a +2 bonus.
Rune of Echoes. Once this battle, when you miss an attack or fail a save, immediately reroll the result. If the reroll is successful, gain +1 to your next attack or save.
Rune of Speed. Gain an immediate move action as an interrupt, or use on your turn to gain +2 to disengage checks."

"You have learned additional rune options. Additionally, you can carve up to 3 runes on your body, but you can still only use one per full heal-up.
Rune of Precision. Your next successful natural even hit this battle deals +1d6 per tier extra damage
Rune of Knowledge. Gain a +2 to a skill check related to one of your backgrounds.
Rune of Disruption. Your next attack interrupts enemy concentration. One of that enemy's ongoing effects immediately ends, or they are prevented from casting a spell until the start of your next turn.
Rune of Accord. You gain +2 to Charisma-based checks for a social encounter and may automatically succeed on one social interaction check if it aligns with one of your backgrounds or past experiences.
Rune of Bloodlines. Gain a trait from an ally’s ancestry for 1 round."
